name: Cook the Book: Strip Steak with Black Beans, Corn, and Cilantro
description: Instead of mashing up my usual mess of potatoes to go along with the hefty New York strip I had sitting in the fridge, I decided to take a cue from The Gloriously Gluten-Free Cookbook by Vanessa Maltin and pair my steak with a cool salad of black beans, corn, tomatoes, and cilantro.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup frozen yellow corn kernels, thawed
1 tablespoon very finely diced jalapeño chile (seeds removed)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the grill or a grill pan. In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, garlic, and oil. Spread the mixture over the steaks and marinate for 30 minutes. Grill the steaks to the desired doneness, 4 to 5 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, combine the black beans, cilantro, tomatoes, corn, onions, juice, and chile. Season with the salt and pepper.
Remove the steaks from the grill and place on plates. Serve the black bean and corn mixture on top.
